rationale: The segment does not contain an intensifier or comparative directly modifying a risk-adjective.
The segment uses 'one-off' and 'no close contacts had become sick', which are reassuring (Q5), not Q2 cues.
'referred' and 'had become sick' are not moderate verbs describing impact.
The segment does not contain a loaded rhetorical question.
The phrases 'referred to the hospitalized patient as a 'one-off'' and 'said no close contacts had become sick' are explicit calming cues minimizing significance and reporting absence of spread.
